ingredients.text: 2 rice cooker cups short grain (11.5 ounces or 326 grams)

recipes.name: Perfect White Rice in a Rice Cooker

ingredients.text: 1/4 cup Sake Or Mirin (a Japanese Rice Wine)
3 cups Japanese short-grain rice, rinsed several times
2 teaspoons of chicken fat or olive oil
1/2 cup chopped onion - green onion (scallions) or yellow onion
Up to 4 cups of stock (amount depends on the type of rice you are using), either chicken stock or vegetable stock for vegetarian option, or a mix of water and stock*
2 teaspoons of Vegesal (or other seasoned salt)
1 pound sushi quality tuna, salmon, yellowtail, snapper
100.0g basmati rice , long grain rice or brown rice
2.0 tbsp toasted pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds
½ cucumber , deseeded and finely chopped
1 small red pepper , deseeded and finely chopped
2 cup rice milk (this makes the recipe dairy-free!)
1/2 cup mochi sweet rice (or just less. You need 20 teaspoons of rice)
1/8 tsp Saigon cinnamon (if your cinnamon is not that strong, add a bit more)

recipes.name: How To Make Rice in a Rice Cooker recipes

ingredients.text: 1 cup short-, medium-, or long-grain white rice
1 vanilla bean, split and seeds scraped
pinch of ground cinnamon or freshly grated nutmeg
1 tbsp butter , plus more for the dish
¼ cup short-grain rice for risotto, such as Arborio
1/2 x vanilla bean, split open (or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract)
1/2 cup dried sour cherries (or any dried fruit you fancy)
2 cup raw rice - long grain, jasmine or short grain rice, 380 g
1 ½ tsp grated lemon zest (from 1/2 lemon)
4 cup cooked basmati or jasmine rice, cooled to room temperature
1 can diced tomatoes and green chiles
1 can diced tomatoes and green chiles
1 cup wehani brown rice (available at major U.S. markets), or your favorite whole grain or wild rice
1/2 pound assorted fresh cherries, pitted, stemmed, quartered
1 handful baby spinach leaves, rolled up into a cigar-shape and thinly sliced (chiffonade)
8 to 10 leaves fresh mint, cut into chiffonade (see above)
1-1/2 tablespoons almond oil (or other nut oil)
1/2 teaspoon raspberry or other fruit vinegar (or more, to taste)
6 cups boiling water, plus extra for rinsing and soaking the rice, mushrooms and shrimp
1 (14.5 ounce) can of chicken broth, divided
1 to 2 tablespoons light soy sauce, or to taste
1/2 teaspoon white pepper, or to taste
2 tablespoons grated and peeled fresh ginger
300.0g basmati rice and wild rice (tilda is a good choice)
300.0g basmati rice and wild rice (tilda is a good choice)
2 cups thick strained yogurt, preferably at room temperature
1 cup pomegranate seeds, fresh or dried
2.5 c. short grained rice (i usually use niko niko)
1.5 lb tofu, or 1 lb tempeh, seitan, spicy vegetarian sausage, etc.
2 big handfuls each of 1-2 vegetables to pan fry (zucchini, broccoli, eggplant, bok choy, …)
4 handfuls total of salad items: lettuce, red onions, fresh herbs, mango, papaya, avocado, carrots, corn, peppers, …
Herbs and spices for making a spice paste, or a bottled sauce of your choice (sweet chili sauce works well)
2 tbsp. annatto-infused oil 3 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped
1 small yellow onion, peeled and finely chopped
1 italian frying or green bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and finely chopped
1 lb. calabaza squash, seeded, peeled, and cut into 1/2" pieces
1/2 red bell pepper, seeded and diced
4 1/2 cups basmati rice or other long-grain white rice
1/3 cup (66 grams) of uncooked short grain white rice
7 ounces salted fresh mozzarella cheese, coarsely shredded (1¾ cups)
1 1/3 cups risotto rice, such as Arborio or Carnaroli
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
½ cup freshly grated Parmigiano -Reggiano cheese
1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
6 cups Rice Krispies (or other puffed rice cereal)
12 to 20 Swedish Fish (or other fish-shaped candy)
1 package of Fruit by the Foot or Fruit Roll-Ups
2 blood oranges (or other if they are not available) cut in supremes
A pinch or 2 of finishing salt - i used a gray cypress salt and it was wonderful
1 tsp each of mustard seeds, black g lentils, yellow split lentils.
1 inch ginger cut into very small pieces
Basmati rice: 2 cups( cooked in 2 cups of water and leave it cool).
1 big lemon: squeeze the juice and keep it aside.
1 can of chili beans in sauce
2 tablespoons olive oil (can use up to 1/4 cup)
2 cups of medium or long-grain white rice
3 cups* chicken stock (or vegetable stock if vegetarian)
1 heaping tablespoon tomato paste or 1 cup of diced fresh or cooked tomatoes, strained
1 medium serrano chile, halved lengthwise and seeded
1 cup short, medium, or long-grain brown rice
Half a stick of butter, plus more for greasing the pan
2 to 3 bunches of spring onions -- like green onions or green shallots, or scallions -- sliced into rings, green parts reserved
2 cups cooked white rice (or more, if you have it)
2 to 3 eggs, depending on how big they are and how much rice you have, beaten with a fork
2 cups grated sharp cheese, like cheddar
1 cup chopped parsley, tightly packed (or mustard greens, etc.)
3 tbsp. butter 1 yellow onion, peeled and finely chopped 3 lbs. fresh peas, shelled to yield 3 cups pinch of salt 1 cup chicken stock
1 cup arborio rice 2 tbsp. chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley grated parmigiano-reggiano

recipes.name: Purple Tai Rice Cooker Sticky Rice

ingredients.text: 2 tablespoons rendered lard or bacon fat or vegetable/canola oil
1.5 cups yellow or white onion, peeled and diced
4 cups rich chicken stock, or bouillon dissolved in water
1 fresh jalapeno or serrano pepper (or more to suite your taste)
2 tablespoons (1/2-inch pieces) angel-hair pasta, broken from about 30 strands
1 1/2 cups or low-sodium store-bought chicken stock
1 small green chile, such as serrano, seeded and thinly sliced
3/4 teaspoon almond extract or 1 bay leaf
1 1/2 cups basmati rice, rinsed and drained
400g/14¼oz tin kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 medium red onions, plus ½ red onion sliced into rings
2 medium red onions, plus ½ red onion sliced into rings
1 red bell pepper, stemmed and cored
1 red habanero chile, stemmed and seeded
1 1" piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced
2 ¼ cups chicken broth or water
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
2 cups thinly sliced leeks, white and light green parts only, rinsed and dried
4 cups day-old cooked rice; Vongerichten recommends jasmine (I used brown jasmine) but this is the perfect way to use up any leftover rice you have, especially from Chinese delivery
2 teaspoons sesame oil (for some heat but the same awesome flavor, use hot sesame oil)
325 grams Japanese short-grain rice (2 rice cooker cups)
8 grams ginger julienned (4 paper thin slices) julienned
100 grams prepared bamboo shoots cut into bite-size pieces
1 medium green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 14-ounce can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 can (19 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 pouch UNCLE BENS® READY RICE® Original Long Grain Rice
1 tsp split chana dal (also called bengal gram lentils)
1 tsp split black gram (also called urad dal or black lentil)
3 tbsp lemon juice, or to taste
560 grams rice – cooked short grain about 3 cups
150 g punnet blackberries (or use frozen and defrost)
3/4 cup short-grain white rice (if unable to locate, try medium-grain white rice in the spanish foods section of store)
3/4 cup golden seedless raisins pre-soaked in warm water
1 cup baby spinach, cut into small pieces
